screeningSummary: First-time witness with Ring camera footage of three lights merging and accelerating straight up

textVariants.text: You're on the air. What did you witness?
Alright, you're on. What'd you see?
YOU ARE ON THE AIR! Tell us what you witnessed!
You're on. Make it quick - what is it?
You're on. So?
Oh good, a caller! What did you see?
You're on. Describe what you observed from the beginning.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Okay so this is gonna sound insane, but last night at about 2 AM I'm letting my dog out and I see these three lights over the lake behind my house. Not planes - they were too deliberate. Just hovering there, completely silent.

textVariants.text: Three lights over the lake. How long were they there?
Three lights... okay, how long were they hovering?
THREE LIGHTS over a lake at 2 AM?! This is AMAZING! How long did they stay?!
Three lights. Of course it was three lights. How long?
Three lights. Fine, I'll listen. How long?
THREE LIGHTS! This is fantastic! How long were they there?!
Three lights in a stationary position. What was the duration of observation?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Five minutes, maybe. I just stood there watching. Then they started moving. Not randomly - they were communicating with each other somehow. They formed a triangle, then merged into one light.

textVariants.text: Merged into one light. That's unusual. What happened after that?
Merged... alright. And then?
THEY MERGED INTO ONE LIGHT?! That's INCREDIBLE! What happened next?!
Merged into one light. Let me guess - it shot straight up?
Merged. Interesting. What happened?
THEY COMMUNICATED AND MERGED! This is the best story of the night! What happened?!
Formation change followed by merger. What was the subsequent behavior of the unified light?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Shot straight up. Gone in less than a second. I have a ring camera that caught the lights, but it didn't catch the departure. Too fast for anything I've ever seen.

textVariants.text: There's a military base about forty miles from you. Could be training exercises with flares or drones.
Look, there's a base out there. Could be military stuff. Just saying.
STRAIGHT UP in less than a second?! That's IMPOSSIBLE for normal aircraft! Could be military tech!
Of course it shot straight up. You know there's a military base out there, right?
There's a base forty miles from you. Could be them testing stuff.
STRAIGHT UP! Gone in a second! This is TEXTBOOK! Military, maybe?
Vertical acceleration at supersonic speeds. Given the proximity to the military installation, what are your thoughts on experimental aircraft or drone swarm testing?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: I thought about that. But flares don't hover for five minutes and then accelerate straight up. I've seen military exercises, Vern. This was something else. I'm not saying aliens, but... I don't know what else to call it.

textVariants.text: Send us that Ring camera footage if you can. Set up your phone next time too. We've got researchers who will analyze every frame. Thanks for calling in.
Yeah, send the footage if you want. Maybe get your phone ready next time. Thanks.
Send us that FOOTAGE! Our team is going to FREAK OUT! Get your phone ready next time! This is AMAZING!
Right, well... send the footage if you want. Maybe try to get video of the departure next time. Thanks.
Send the footage in. Maybe charge your phone next time. Thanks for calling.
Send us that RING CAMERA footage! This is PERFECT! Get your phone ready for next time! We love this!

Please submit that footage to our research division for frame-by-frame analysis. Additionally, we recommend having a secondary recording device prepared for future observations. Thank you for your report.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Will do, Vern. I've already got my camera set up for tonight. Something's happening out there and I want to catch it.

arcNotes: First-time witness, was skeptical before, now believes something is happening, has some footage
